Team Leader Visitor Services

Temporary Full Time until November 2019

834522961:
[

V&V / Senior Systems Engineers - EOI

Company Name Nova Systems Company Location Southbank, Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 34 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


The successful introduction of a capability, whether it is a defence system or a complex commercial plant such as an LNG field, depends on a thorough and rigorous process of testing and commissioning. The best-laid plans almost never survive the first contact with the enemy, and commissioning and test is the crucial risk reduction and operationalisation stage where the complex capability is put through its paces in a controlled environment before being made live.

Our people understand the technology and the operational environment, and most importantly, the need of testing complex capability in a gradual manner that eliminates the risks of introducing a complex capability into operational service. From developmental testing through to live field test, we provide the expertise from initial commissioning and test planning in the early project phases through to executing the tests and delivering capability to our customers.

About the opportunity:
Nova Systems is currently seeking expressions of interest (EOI) from V&V / Senior Systems Engineers to join our Melbourne Operations. You'll be working on site with clients participating in and/or managing Test and Evaluation (T&E) activities, incorporating all of the Acceptance, Developmental and Operational T&E disciplines across a range of Defence platforms and equipment. Other responsibilities could include the application of these T&E services for our non-Defence clients such as those in the Mining, Utilities and Rail sectors.

What will you be involved in:

  • Test and Evaluation/Verification and Validation;
  • Systems and/or Process design and design review;
  • Systems safety assessment and risk analysis;
  • Trial planning, executing, and reporting;
  • Requirements and configuration management.


What we would like from you:

  • Engineering Degree (Communications, Software, Electronics, Systems Engineering, Mechatronics, or Aerospace);
  • Ideally 8 years' experience in a Defence or Defence Industry environment;
  • Complex project and systems engineering experience;
  • AUSDEFCON experience (preferred but not essential).


About you:

  • Motivated and driven to provide outstanding service to clients and stakeholders;
  • Australian Citizen - Eligible for AGSVA BASELINE or higher;
  • Passionate and a team player.


What is it like to work with us?
As a professional services firm, we recognise that it's our people who are our greatest asset. At Nova we work on some pretty interesting, diverse and at times highly complex projects. We ensure employees have the opportunity to work in a unique environment that is fun and down-to-earth, while having the support to perform to the best of their ability in the safest possible manner.

We commit to giving all employees the opportunity to grow their skills, gain valuable experience and develop professionally. Everyone at Nova can expect open, direct communication from their leaders and peers. Everyone at Nova can expect to be rewarded for their efforts.

We commit to providing equal opportunities to all Novan's, and recognise that honesty, fairness, mutual respect and the responsible exercise of power are fundamental to achieving equity for all.

What you get beyond the pay cheque:
With a strong company culture and high retention rate, Nova Systems has been recognised as one of "Top 50 best places to work" in Australia. In addition, Nova was recently ranked in the "Top 50 Most Innovative Companies".

  • Flexible working conditions;
  • Access to Defence Health, Travel and Life Insurance;
  • Annual 3-day Conference;
  • Personal and Professional Development Allowance and Leave;
  • Reserve Leave;
  • Loyalty Leave;
  • Purchased Leave;
  • Novated Leasing and Salary Sacrifice;
  • Serious Illness Leave;
  • Nova Employee Share Offer;
  • Mentoring Program;
  • Innovation Program;
  • Do you own a Safari Suit or Kaftan? Sense of humour required!


To apply, please click on the "apply now" button and submit your resume using the "upload resume" function.

Alternatively, for a confidential discussion contact Emma in Nova's Talent Acquisition Team on (08) 8252 7100.

No recruitment agencies please.

Seniority Level

Mid-Senior level

Industry

  • Aviation & Aerospace
  • Defense & Space

Employment Type

Full-time

Job Functions

  • Consulting
  • Engineering
  • Project Management

835885173:
[

Business Development Manager, Telstra Enterprise

Company Name Apple Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 13 hours ago Number of views 49 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The people here at Apple don’t just create products — they create the kind of wonder that’s revolutionised entire industries. It’s the diversity of those people and their ideas that inspires the innovation that runs through everything we do, from amazing technology to industry-leading environmental efforts. Join Apple, and help us leave the world better than we found it.
Apple’s Sales organisation generates the revenue needed to fuel our ongoing development of products and services. This in turn, enriches the lives of hundreds of millions of people around the world. Our sales team, is in many ways, the face of Apple to our largest customers.
A unique opportunity exists for an extraordinary individual with strong relationship, deep strategic, commercial and sound execution skills to join Apple’s carrier sales team, partnering with Telstra to deliver innovative solutions to enterprise customers.

Description

This position looks for an excellent individual with strong relationship, influencing skills and business acumen to work in Apple’s carrier sales team. The role will actively work with the Telstra Enterprise sales organisation to drive extraordinary customer outcomes leveraging the extensive products and services of both organisations. Success involves identifying customer opportunities and supporting them through to conclusion as well as scaling industry solutions.
You are passionate about technology and the impact Apple’s products can have in transforming business practices and workflows in the Enterprise to deliver enhanced productivity and improved employee engagement.
You are a compelling story teller and authentic brand and product ambassador, one who’s inspired to learn and does not shy away from hard work. It will draw on your innovative approach to problem solving, ability to prioritise and run multiple initiatives in parallel and a focus on what is going to deliver the best commercial outcomes for Apple and Telstra.
Develop & maintain relationships with relevant partner, understanding their focus areas, objectives and commercial priorities.
Share your deep knowledge of Enterprise mobility, Business transformation and Apple’s products and services, enabling Telstra’s sales team to inspire customers.
Identify customer opportunities and work closely with Telstra and the broader Apple team to deliver transformative customer outcomes.
Build an annual enterprise account plan, quarter by quarter aligned to a strategic plan to drive Apple sales with differentiated Telstra offers based on the Apple ecosystem and portfolio of products, leveraging all Telstra sales and marketing channels.
Work closely with the Apple Enterprise Sales teams, industry and technical specialists and Sales Engineers to bring together the best of the Apple ecosystem to Telstra’s customer base
Analyse emerging trends and partner capabilities to create and capitalise on the opportunities identified.

Key Qualifications

You have shown success in sales, account management, commercial or consulting experience within the telecommunications or technology service sectors.
You possess a sound knowledge of Enterprise-class IT technologies including cloud solutions, mobile applications and mobility platforms.
Your background in telecommunications, IT and mobility has embedded a deep understanding of the economic and customer value drivers that are of critical importance to our partner.
You are proficient in account planning and management, pipeline development and creating new revenue generating opportunities.
A significant part of your career has been influencing others to follow your lead, your thinking and your proven ability to implement.
You can write concisely and effectively and are a captivating presenter. You have the ability to deliver results by building rapport and understand the importance of building influence in a highly matrixed, functional organisation.
You possess sound analytical skills and business insight.
You are adaptable, thrive on making the complex simple and deal with ambiguity with a smile.
Finally, you understand how to work in a collaborative and flexible way, as a local member of a global organisation.

Apple People

Additional Requirements

Apple people are talented, collaborative, confident, patient, creative, persistent, committed, passionate, authentic and have an excellent sense of humour. A shared obsession for quality in everything we do is much admired.
Anyone joining us shares these attributes and our values, and can demonstrate their own special magic.

Apple Values

Actively practice teamwork; Take initiative and challenge the status quo; Deliver more than the customer expects; Be dependable and reliable – follow-up quickly and consistently; Demonstrate a positive, friendly and approachable demeanour.
Apple is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer committed to inclusion and diversity.

Commericalisation Manager

Company Name Incitec Pivot Limited Company Location Southbank, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 90 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • ASX100 – global manufacturer & marketer of commercial explosives, fertilisers and industrial explosives
  • Be part of our exciting growth and innovation journey
  • Execute a “pull” strategy across bespoke commercial and BD portfolios

\xa0

About Us

Working at Incitec Pivot Limited (IPL) provides the opportunity to progress your career with a global leader in the resources and agricultural sectors with an unrelenting focus on Zero Harm. With a diverse leadership, we add value for our customers through our people, manufacturing excellence, innovation and world class services. Through its integrated business model, IPL's 4,500 employees manufacture and market explosives, industrial chemicals and fertiliser products and services to customers around the world.

\xa0

The Role

Reporting to the Vice President Agronomy & Innovation, you will lead new product and service introductions through our lifecycle management process delivering revenue growth. A diverse range of opportunities will range from hi tech laboratory decision support apps through to patented fertiliser efficiency enhancers. Leveraging your deep commercial and business development expertise, you will execute strategy to develop markets with new and existing customers aligned with IPL’s vision. \xa0

\xa0

Working within a matrix structure, you will engage across a range of functions to ensure project readiness for commercialisation. You will then deploy a “pull strategy” to drive customer understanding of the value proposition to ensure that financial objectives are met. .

You will achieve this by:

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Providing clarity to functional stakeholders about why they should come on board with a project

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Deployment and leadership of appropriately skilled resources

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Excellent communication skills

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Exceptional client relationships and market intelligence to set financial and volume plans

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Leveraging IPL’s integrated business planning resources and sales capability in a collaborative manner

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Inclusive & visionary leadership style bringing partners on the commercialisation journey

\xa0

About You

Tertiary qualified in marketing / business administration, integrated business planning or related field, you offer significant commercial experience ideally within the agriculture sector or related industries. You have a proven track record of managing successful and industry recognised product service introductions and is considered an industry subject matter expert that can influence the way things are done.

\xa0

Leveraging your strong capability in integrated business planning & industry leading stage gate processes, you offer exceptional program and change management capabilities that align and meet strategic profitability and agreed business growth plans. Enjoying the ability to coach and mentor, your personal style is approachable, collaborative and thrives in a high-trust, high-performing culture.

\xa0

Drawing upon insights from complex data sets to coach/educate key stakeholders concerning these trends underpins your key engagement capabilities for better profitability and sustainability for our business. You are an entrepreneur at heart but you manage risk through your exceptional planning and organisational skills which drive team performance.

\xa0

Benefits to you

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 As an industry leader with a strong emphasis on safety and innovation, we offer career trajectory opportunities for your long term goals. .

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 We are a team based on trust, collaboration and respect

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 An above market attractive salary package is offered.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 This is your opportunity to be part of a growing organisation where you can have an impact on the change and future vision.

\xa0

\xa0

If this is your next career opportunity simply select "apply now" button or to learn more about this role contact Katie Le Page – Senior HR Shared Services Advisor on 07 3867 9414.

\xa0

A little more about us

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 At the heart of Incitec Pivot and Dyno Nobel’s culture is business excellence and we seek like-minded individuals who treat the business as their own and who strive to challenge and improve the status quo, focusing on improving productivity whilst maintaining zero harm for everyone, everywhere.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 The culture of safety is paramount and you will play an integral part in promoting Health Safety & Environment (HSE) procedures to ensure Zero Harm at all times. You will also be familiar with modern safety practices as well as have the ability to pass a pre-employment medical assessment (including a drug and alcohol screen).

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 We support diversity in the workplace; women, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders and people with a multicultural background are strongly encouraged to apply.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Dyno Nobel and Incitec Pivot Limited is a proud member of the Diversity Council of Australia and Male Champions of Change, and holds a State Chair position on the National Association of Women in Operations.
\xa0

\xa0

Our Company Strategy is;

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Our key strategic priorities are based around being the best global explosives and international fertiliser company in the resources and agricultural markets.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Our unrelenting focus on Zero Harm is central to our strategy along with delivering added value to our customers through manufacturing excellence, product innovation and world class service.

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 We execute our strategy by positioning ourselves on the input side of the value chain, leveraging our core nitrogen value chain competency and high explosives chemicals manufacturing expertise, and by servicing customers through our market leading Business brands of Dyno Nobel and Incitec Pivot Fertilisers.

\xa0

Learn more about our company values via the link below;

https://www.incitecpivot.com.au/about-us/about-incitec-pivot-limited/company-values

\xa0

Our Diversity Initiatives is a cornerstone in our culture and welcoming nature, we expand on this via the link below;

https://www.incitecpivot.com.au/about-us/about-incitec-pivot-limited/diversity-initiative


We are led by an extraordinary team of dedicated and inclusive people, to know them more select the link below;

https://www.incitecpivot.com.au/about-us/about-incitec-pivot-limited/board-of-directors

\xa0

Marketing Manager - Yoghurt & Desserts

Company Name Parmalat Australia Company Location Scoresby, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 176 views

Job description

  • Global FMCG business
  • Iconic Australian brands
  • Progressive team environment and culture


About the Opportunity


Want to make a difference ? See challenges as opportunities? Are passionate and love what you do?


Are focussed on what really drives commercial results ? An intuitive marketer? Love a fast paced environment and are agile?


If this sounds like you, if you want to join a business that is experiencing strong growth because it has clear direction and over 2500 dedicated passionate team members who work across 15 sites, this exciting Marketing Manager role could be for you.


We are a dairy industry leader globally and in Australia, with an amazing portfolio of iconic brands such as Pauls, Vaalia, Ice Break, OAK, Galbani and Lemnos. This is a rare opportunity to head up marketing for one of our most significant portfolio’s being the Yoghurt and Dairy Desserts brands.\xa0 Working as part of a SBU you will have the investment and resources to drive some very significant commercial results.


Parmalat Australia is part of the global Parmalat Group, which is owned by the Lactalis Groupe, the world's largest producer of Dairy Foods.\xa0 We are committed to positively contributing to the daily health and well-being of consumers throughout the world, via the provision of nutritious dairy products – milk, cheese, yoghurt, deserts and other soft foods and beverages.


We are a growing global company that takes great pride in who we are. We are humble, proud and resilient. Our brands, people and know how define who we are.

\xa0

We provide a safe workplace that delivers the opportunity to drive your development, and believe that true success comes from us.

\xa0

Collaboration, flexibility and diversity are pillars of our environment. With knowledge and experience we encourage you to make a difference!

\xa0

A great role to develop your career, if you have these skill sets:


  • A creative approach and experience leading a team and working with a diverse group of stakeholders and suppliers.
  • Prior experience in marketing FMCG is essential and a mix of agency and commercial experience is a plus.\xa0
  • Track record working with the management team, advisors and external stakeholders to develop strategic marketing plans and initiatives in line with business objectives.
  • Managing the execution of marketing initiatives across platforms and channels via both internal and external resources, with full accountability for results achieved.
  • Full management of external marketing providers, including accountability for budgets and KPIs.
  • Excellent time management and organisational skills, a high attention to detail, strong work ethic and a passion for great marketing.
  • Be adept at developing and executing marketing strategies that generate increased sales and brand equity.
  • Possess outstanding organisational and time management skills with a demonstrated ability to handle conflicting priorities and meet deadlines in a high pressure environment

\xa0

Ideally you will have:


  • At least 5 years in a Management role in a relevant industry or company (Commercial or Commercial and agency mix).
  • Have demonstrated success in working with diverse stakeholders including suppliers, an excellent collaborator.
  • Be able to demonstrate sound strategic insight into the opportunities and challenges facing the business and the industry, and use this insight to shape and drive initiatives, plans and deliver successful outcomes.


A unique and amazing role!\xa0 If you are confident you have the experience, you have the ambition and drive to succeed in this role and wish to join an impressive global business and be part of a progressive working environment, we are interested in hearing from you.\xa0


Submit your application, including current resume by selecting 'Apply' and following the prompts.


No Recruitment Agencies: We have this one covered!

\xa0

\xa0

Senior Urban Design Specialist

Company Name North East Link Authority Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 weeks ago Number of views 59 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • This is your opportunity to lead the urban design strategy for Victoria's largest road transport project!
  • Newly created position; make your mark on this brand-new role!
  • Work within a team that has defined goals, an inspirational vision and delivers tangible outcomes for all Victorians!
  • Fixed term 3 years - VPS 6 - $116, 863 - $156, 387 plus super & flexible working arrangements


Senior Urban Design Specialist

Are you an experienced Landscape Architect, Urban Designer or Urban Planner looking to make your mark on a major project? This may be the perfect opportunity for you!


The North East Link Authority is currently seeking a Senior Urban Design Specialist to join our Land, Planning and Environment team. Reporting to the Manager, Planning this role will enable you to develop and implement the North East Link Authority’s (NELA) Urban Design Strategy and leave a lasting legacy in Melbourne’s north eastern suburbs for years to come.


This position will also provide you with the opportunity to lead and inspire a team of internal staff members and technical advisors to assist in the review and evaluation processes for urban design documentation and design packages throughout the life of the North East Link Project.


Key to your application will be your urban design expertise as well as your experience in leading the development and execution of strategic documents or proponent bids for a complex project. Your knowledge of procurement and tender processes will be advantageous to your success within the role. An aptitude to develop positive relationships and work collaboratively with a diverse range of internal and external stakeholders will see you thrive in this role.


Benefits

Not only is this a fantastic opportunity to join a growing organisation, in a position which offers variety and exposure to a major project environment, but we also offer a series of benefits including:

  • Flexible working arrangements to support work/life balance.\xa0
  • Salary packaging of superannuation and motor vehicle novated leases.
  • Generous leave entitlements, including the opportunity to purchase up to an additional eight weeks' leave per annum.
  • An annual performance and development scheme, with performance-based salary increases.
  • Savings on public transport via the Myki Commuter Club.


For more information on this opportunity please contact Katie Watt – Director, Land, Planning and Environment on (03) 9027 5975.


To apply please submit a cover letter addressing your suitability for the role and your CV via:

https://jobs.careers.vic.gov.au/jobs/VG-001633x


Applications close at 11:59pm on Sunday 9 September 2018.


North East Link Authority is committed to sustaining a diverse workforce. We invite applications from men and women of all ages including people with a disability and indigenous Australians to apply.
